title: Iraq's Kadhimi, Trump Sidestep Setting Deadline for Withdrawing U.S. Troops From Iraq
summary: White House meeting was part of top-level effort to bolster ties between the two nations. WASHINGTON-Iraq's new prime minister and President Trump refrained on Thursday from setting a schedule for withdrawing American troops from the country, as they grappled with the threat posed by remnants of Islamic State and the ongoing need to train Iraqi forces.

title: The Oracle of Trump
summary: The President endorses a TikTok purchase by one of his corporate supporters.. President Trump often forgets that he's not a TV pundit and that his impulsive comments can do real damage to financial markets, confidence in the law, and his own standing. The latest example is his apparent endorsement on Tuesday of Oracle 's purchase of social media app TikTok.

title: Iraq's Kadhimi Opportunity
summary: The U.S. can help the PM beat back Iran and suppress jihadists.. Headlines from President Trump's Oval Office press appearance with Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa Al-Kadhimi on Thursday focused on Mr. Trump's answers about his tax returns and the indictment of Steve Bannon. But the real news from the meeting is a more promising partnership between the U.S. and Iraq. With U.S. support, Iraq can suppress Sunni terrorism and Iran-backed militias, helping to maintain a regional balance of power that will prevent future American interventions.

title: How to Set World Trade Straight
summary: Bilateral pacts promote protectionism. The WTO needs to return to the vision of equal rules for all.. There seems to be a growing international consensus for a "reset" of the World Trade Organization-and for good reason. The international trading system has devolved into one of wildly uneven tariffs, rules that apply to some countries but not others, and scores of so-called free-trade agreements that in many cases codify protectionism and undermine the core WTO principle of most-favored-nation treatment. At the same time, the WTO's dispute-settlement system rewards litigation over negotiation and has attempted to create a jurisprudence often divorced from the text of the rules agreed to by the WTO's member states.

title: Meet Canada's 'Minister of Everything'
summary: Chrystia Freeland may one day succeed Justin Trudeau.. Toronto

title: The Obama-Biden Virus Response
summary: If H1N1 had proved as deadly as Covid-19, it could have killed nearly two million.. Is it reasonable to blame a single politician for the spread of a highly infectious virus, especially in a free country with 50 states and 330 million people? Joe Biden is lucky that wasn't the standard a decade ago.

title: Harris vs. the Knights of Columbus
summary: Can the Democrats tolerate Catholics who take the church's teachings seriously?. Kamala Harris had a question for Brian Buescher. "Since 1993, you have been a member of the Knights of Columbus, an all-male society comprised primarily of Catholic men," the California senator wrote Mr. Buescher in 2018, while considering his nomination to sit on the U.S. District Court in Nebraska. "Were you aware that the Knights of Columbus opposed a woman's right to choose when you joined the organization?"

title: 'And in the End' Review: Band on the Run
summary: The Beatles' ﬁnal year was silly, crazy and chaotic, but the music they made then is still with us-as are tales of the Fab Four.. Among the horrors that beset some aging boomers is the harrowing suspicion that there is more music in Rachmaninoff's Second Piano Concerto than in the entire Beatles catalog. But of course not everyone feels that way. Existing for around eight years and gone for 50, the Beatles and their signature hits are still very much with us. If the Fab Four didn't roll over Beethoven in the composing competition, they certainly overshadowed him in mass popularity. And they continue to inspire a kind of pop anthropology, in which their life and times are chronicled in detail and mined for cultural insights.

title: Bannon Charged in Alleged Border-Wall Fundraising Scheme
summary: Former Trump adviser and three others indicted on fraud charges over activities involving online crowdfunding campaign called We Build the Wall. Former senior Trump adviser Steve Bannon was arrested and charged with fraud Thursday in connection with an alleged scheme to siphon hundreds of thousands of dollars from a crowdfunding campaign backing one of the president's signature promises: building a wall along the southern U.S. border.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg Questioned in FTC Antitrust Probe
summary: Appearance comes as agency is under fire by some for not doing more. WASHINGTON-The Federal Trade Commission this week questioned Facebook Inc. founder Mark Zuckerberg in its probe into whether the social-media giant has violated U.S. antitrust laws, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Michaels Hires Pizza Hut U.S. CFO as Finance Chief
summary: Michael Diamond's base salary is set at $635,000. Michaels Cos. hired Michael Diamond as its next chief financial officer, effective Sept. 1, the company said Thursday.

title: Lyft, Uber Get More Time as They Fight California Order
summary: Ride-hailing companies can continue operating while they challenge order to reclassify drivers. Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. will be able to continue conducting business as usual in California for now, after a state appeals court on Thursday paused a lower-court ruling that required the ride-hailing companies to reclassify their drivers as employees.

title: A Ferocious Phillies Fan at Fenway
summary: At an empty stadium in enemy territory, a fan's streak survives-barely.. For a while there, it looked like my 62-year streak of seeing at least one Phillies game every year was over. Yes, baseball was being played again, but without exuberant fans-or any fans-in the stands. So during this weird, forlorn season, there seemed to be no chance of me seeing the Phils pound the old horsehide.

title: U.S. Allies Reject Bid to Reinstate Iran Sanctions, Opening Diplomatic Rift
summary: U.K., France, Germany say U.S. lacks standing to restore U.N. sanctions, having withdrawn from 2015 nuclear deal. The U.S.'s closest allies on Thursday rebuked the Trump administration over its effort to reinstate international sanctions on Iran, opening a rift in the United Nations Security Council over the handling of Tehran's nuclear program and its regional ambitions.

title: Time to Address Fundamental USPS Reform
summary: I'm glad we're having an uproar over postal service. The pols didn't get excited about it until it was about their ballots.. Regarding your editorial "The Post Office's Problem Isn't Trump" (Aug. 14): Eliminate half of all residential delivery days. Your home mail would come on M-W-F or on Tu-Th-Sat. Labor costs and overtime could be reduced. The only hardship would be the delay of some Amazon or Netflix items by a day. This new service frequency could be phased in over several years to cushion employment disruptions.

title: Beating Addiction, Going Beyond One's Self
summary: A need to acknowledge nontheological possibilities of healing is itself an interesting comment on our culture. This wouldn't be news in Europe.. We appreciate Mary Beth O'Connor's "I Beat Addiction Without God" (Houses of Worship, Aug. 14). There are indeed many paths to recover from addiction, and millions do so on their own. A need to acknowledge nontheological possibilities of healing is itself an interesting comment on our culture. This wouldn't be news in Europe, nor would a piece on "I Beat Cancer Without God" be noteworthy. Classic Judeo-Christian thought affirms human freedom and capacity to change. Leaders of 12-step groups are free to express their own opinions, but Bill W., the co-founder of Alcoholics Anonymous, never claimed it to be the only way, but just one way that its members had found to be effective. Clinical research clearly demonstrates that we are blessed with a variety of effective options in treating addictions, including a 12-step approach.

title: Hopeful but Not Optimistic About a Biden Stock Boom
summary: A Biden administration will increase taxes on companies and individuals significantly, and ramp up the cost of doing business, but still propel the stock market to above-average annual gains of 15%?. In "Get Ready for the Biden Stock Boom" (op-ed, Aug. 11), Ed Finn seems to rely on a very small word to make his case: "if."

title: Maybe It's Time to Examine Your Voting Assumptions
summary: When the people elected the current mayor of New York, Bill de Blasio, his background and radical politics were well known.. Regarding Julia Vitullo-Martin's "Covid Powers Wreck My Neighborhood" (op-ed, Aug. 13): I am equally as saddened as Ms. Vitullo-Martin is about the catastrophic collapse of the Upper West Side, as well as almost everywhere in New York City. I have stayed in the hotels there, and I can only imagine what the day-to-day environment in your neighborhood has become.

title: Michigan to Pay $600 Million to Flint Residents
summary: Settlement helps resolve five-year legal fight over one of nation's worst public-health emergencies. Five years after the lead-tainted drinking water crisis in Flint, one of the nation's worst public health emergencies, the state of Michigan has reached a settlement to compensate residents.

title: California Wildfires Rage Despite Break in Heat Wave
summary: Firefighters gained some control but blazes near San Francisco are just 7% contained. VACAVILLE, Calif.-Firefighters took advantage of a break in extreme heat wave conditions to gain more control over numerous wildfires that have prompted evacuations and blanketed wide swaths of the state in smoke.

title: U.S. Coronavirus Deaths Top 173,000
summary: Covid-19 infections exceed 5.5 million in the U.S. as countries struggle to contain outbreaks. The number of new U.S. coronavirus cases edged up to more than 46,000 while the nation's death toll topped 173,000, driven in part by fatalities in four states that were virus hot spots throughout July.

title: New York Schools Chief Warns of Teacher Layoffs if State Cuts Aid
summary: Chancellor says cutbacks would threaten in-person instruction this year; city and state officials call for federal relief. New York City schools Chancellor Richard Carranza warned that the system might have to lay off 9,000 teachers and call off in-person instruction this year if the state forges ahead with threatened cuts to school aid and doesn't let the city borrow more money.

title: Volkswagen Notches Early Win in Legal Fight With SEC
summary: Judge dismisses part of securities fraud case over diesel cheating scandal. WASHINGTON-A federal judge on Thursday dismissed part of a civil fraud case against Volkswagen AG , a ruling that validated the company's claims that regulators piled on with a 2019 lawsuit over its emissions scandal.

title: Former Uber Security Chief Charged Criminally in Connection With 2016 Hack
summary: Joe Sullivan is accused of concealing details of massive breach from federal authorities. Uber Technologies Inc.'s former chief security officer, Joe Sullivan, was charged Thursday for allegedly concealing from federal authorities details about the massive data breach the ride-hailing giant suffered in 2016.

title: 'Maybe I Should Go to Jail.' Neiman Investor Slammed in Government Report
summary: Hedge-fund founder Dan Kamensky tried to scuttle a competing offer for Neiman Marcus assets, 'to the likely detriment of all other creditors,' according to Justice Department watchdogs. When hedge-fund manager Dan Kamensky found out a prominent investment bank might challenge him for a piece of Neiman Marcus Group Ltd.'s crown-jewel asset, he set about eliminating his competition, a government inquiry found.

title: 'Desert One' Review: Heroism and Heartbreak
summary: Barbara Kopple's documentary feature examines the 1980 special forces mission launched secretly by President Jimmy Carter in an attempt to end the Iran hostage crisis.. 'Desert One," a superb documentary by Barbara Kopple, snatches high drama from the jaws of devastating failure. It's an investigation, and resourceful re-creation, of the clandestine, ill-fated special forces mission that President Jimmy Carter launched four decades ago in an attempt to free 52 Americans taken hostage in the U.S. Embassy in Tehran in late 1979 by revolutionaries loyal to the Ayatollah Khomeini after they overthrew the government of Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi. (The film opens Friday in theaters and online: details at desertonemovie.com.)

title: U.S. Stocks Edge Higher, Led by Tech Shares
summary: Tech stocks have benefited from statewide lockdown measures that have accelerated the adoption of online shopping, digital communication and other services. Technology stocks pulled major U.S. indexes higher Thursday, as a handful of companies continued to power the newly minted bull market.

title: 'The King and I' Review: Something Wonderful, on the Small Screen
summary: Bartlett Sher's fine 2015 revival of the Rodgers and Hammerstein classic is arrestingly captured in PBS's recording of the production.. PBS is following up its telecasts of "Present Laughter" and "Much Ado About Nothing," which were also made available for viewing via streaming video, with one of the very best musicals that Lincoln Center Theater has produced, Bartlett Sher's 2015 revival of "The King and I." I've had mixed feelings about more than a few of Mr. Sher's Broadway revivals, but this one, which starred Kelli O'Hara, was a knockout and a wow, the finest staging of the show I've seen, and it's a most agreeable surprise to see how fully it translates to the small screen.

title: 'Family Business' Review: Of Law and Relationships
summary: On Acorn TV, a scintillating French series about a mother-daughter team of lawyers. There's an old-school flavor about the characters and plot lines of this captivating work notwithstanding its distinctly up-to-date design-the business in "Family Business" (Monday, Acorn TV) is an all-female firm of top lawyers, led by a mother and daughter. The clients they serve, or more precisely minister to, are mostly victims caught up in the darkest of family relationships, the most embittering of struggles, all woven into the eight episodes of this series.

title: Engaged Capital Targets Evolent Health
summary: Activist investor buys stake in health-care services company; seeks changes, including a potential sale. Activist investor Engaged Capital LLC is taking aim at health-care software and services company Evolent Health Inc., amassing a 9.9% stake and demanding changes to operations or alternatives including a potential sale, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: CBS Seeking Over $5 Million for 2021 Super Bowl Ads
summary: Ad buyers seek assurances they will be let out of their commitments in the event the game can't be played, sources say. ViacomCBS Inc.'s CBS is seeking around $5.5 million for 30-second commercial spots in next year's Super Bowl, roughly in line with commercial prices in the 2020 game, according to people close to the talks.

title: 'Coup 53' Review: A Long Arc of Middle East History
summary: In a documentary with contemporary resonance, Taghi Amirani evokes the 1953 coup d'état that overthrew the government of Iranian Prime Minister Mohammad Mossadegh. This week brings another documentary about Iran, Taghi Amirani's "Coup 53." A re-examination of the Anglo-American coup d'etat that overthrew the government of Prime Minister Mohammad Mossadegh in the summer of 1953, it's a perfect companion piece to "Desert One," and a formidable achievement in its own right. (For viewing options go to coup53.com.) In our fragmented era, when information comes at us in torrents or spurts, history is often perceived as a mosaic of discrete occurrences, rather than a tapestry of causes and effects. Mr. Amirani, a physicist turned filmmaker, goes back to a first cause, the Western intervention that restored the Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi to power and led slowly though directly to the Islamic revolution that swept Iran in 1979; to the taking of American hostages at the U.S. Embassy; to the Desert One mission that attempted to rescue them; and, indirectly though inexorably, to the hair-trigger hostility that continues to grip Tehran and Washington.

title: Clinton 'Really Meant It'
summary: A credibility issue for the Democrats.. Democrats appearing Wednesday night via their party's virtual national convention certainly appeared somber and sincere. But the content of their oratory naturally raises the question of how seriously viewers should take them.

title: Buyout Firm EQT's Stock Slumps as Earnings Disappoint
summary: Sweden-based buyout firm pays price for disappointing half-year results as valuation risks mount. Europe's EQT AB's stock sank almost 15% Thursday, an abrupt end to the global buyout firm's stock surge this year as the tough investing climate triggered by the coronavirus pandemic challenges the industry's ability to generate outsize returns.

title: Putin Rival Alexei Navalny in Critical Condition After Suspected Poisoning
summary: Opposition leader is breathing with the help of a ventilator at a Siberian hospital, according to his spokeswoman. MOSCOW-Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny, a fierce critic of President Vladimir Putin and Moscow's political elite, was admitted to the intensive-care unit at a Siberian hospital after a suspected poisoning left him unconscious, his spokeswoman said.

title: Another Putin Critic Falls Ill
summary: Opposition leader Alexei Navalny sips tea that may have been poisoned.. Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was in a coma and breathing with a ventilator on Thursday after a likely poisoning. He is one of the most prominent and effective critics of Vladimir Putin's regime, and the news is devastating for Russia's resistance.

title: Sen. Bill Cassidy Tests Positive for Covid-19
summary: Louisiana Republican becomes 15th member of Congress to test positive for the virus or its antibodies. WASHINGTON-Sen. Bill Cassidy (R., La.) tested positive for Covid-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus, his office said Thursday. He has experienced mild symptoms, according to an aide.

title: Bayer Settles Essure Birth-Control Litigation for $1.6 Billion
summary: The German company has been on a settlement spree in the U.S.. Bayer AG said Thursday it will pay $1.6 billion to settle claims that its birth control device Essure causes serious health complications, the latest in a string of settlements by the German company to resolve litigation it faces in the U.S.

title: Extended Montreal Dock Workers' Walkout Rattles Canadian Supply Chains
summary: The 11-day-old strike has led some companies to reroute goods to other Canadian and U.S. ports, employers say. TORONTO-A strike at Canada's second-busiest port is showing few signs of progress deep into the second week of the walkout, as concerns rise about the damage an extended shutdown could do to the Canadian economy.

title: U.S. Colleges Are Taking Steps to Protect Students From China's National-Security Law
summary: Some students will use code names at Princeton University to protect their identities. Thousands of college students from mainland China and Hong Kong will be logging onto American college classes, many from home, this semester. They'll be subject to a new Chinese national-security law, which bars what it calls sedition, subversion, terrorism and colluding with foreign forces. Some academics fear the classes could be recorded and ultimately end up in the hands of Chinese authorities. Schools are considering steps to try to shield students and faculty from prosecution by China. They're particularly concerned about how to handle teaching politically sensitive subjects, like the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre. Some college classes will carry warning labels. Other schools, like Princeton University will use codes instead of names on the work submitted in a Chinese politics class to protect students' identities. An Amherst professor is considering anonymous online chats with students, while Harvard Business School may excuse students from discussing sensitive topics. The three schools declined to comment.

title: News Publishers Join Fight Against Apple Over App Store Terms
summary: The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal are among companies seeking more favorable terms in Apple's app store. Major news organizations are joining the growing chorus of companies pushing for more favorable terms on Apple Inc.'s App Store, a crucial link to new digital customers.

title: J&J Plans Pivotal Trial for Covid-19 Vaccine
summary: The planned phase 3 trial would have double the number of subjects expected to enroll in late-stage studies of other vaccines. Johnson & Johnson plans to launch by late September what could become the largest clinical trial of a coronavirus vaccine to date, enlisting up to 60,000 people world-wide to test whether its experimental shot safely protects from Covid-19.

title: LeBron James, Lakers Make a Statement With Breonna Taylor Hats
summary: The NBA players wore MAGA-style hats calling for the arrest of the "Cops Who Killed Breonna Taylor". Before they began their NBA playoff game Tuesday, the Los Angeles Lakers, including LeBron James, donned hats that, on first glance, looked like the "Make America Great Again" caps often worn by President Trump's supporters. But in the players' version, the "Great Again," was crossed out, and replaced with the words "Arrest the Cops Who Killed Breonna Taylor."

title: Bestselling Books Week Ended August 15
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: Nvidia's Switch Hit
summary: Three-year-old game console is still boosting the chip maker's revenue. The market may be hot on Nvidia 's latest data-center chips, but a three-year-old videogame console is still playing a big role at the chip maker.

title: New York Lawmakers Urge Utilities to Overhaul Practices Following Outages
summary: Regulators want companies to have more crews available ahead of future storms. Lawmakers demanded in a hearing Thursday that utilities make sweeping changes to better prepare for future storms, weeks after Tropical Storm Isaias left hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers without power.

title: Florida Charges Guggenheim Insurance Chief for Role in Boat Crash
summary: Daniel Towriss pleads not guilty to five misdemeanors including negligence and reckless driving. Florida prosecutors charged Guggenheim Partners's top insurance executive with negligence and reckless driving stemming from his role in a late December boating collision near Fort Lauderdale.

title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Restore Ability to Block Twitter Followers
summary: Appeals court said president violated individuals' First Amendment rights when he blocked them after they criticized him. WASHINGTON-The White House asked the Supreme Court on Thursday to restore President Trump's power to block individual Americans from following his Twitter account, an act that lower courts found violated citizens' First Amendment rights.

title: Back to School: Everything Kids Need to Succeed at Virtual Learning
summary: From intuitive tablets to flexible seating that helps kids focus, a properly equipped 'classroom' will help set your child up to succeed while learning from home. THIS SPRING, when schools were closing faster than dominoes toppling, many parents did their best to cobble together a makeshift classroom at the kitchen table. An old laptop. Hand-me-down headphones. Broken Crayolas. Now, as many states extend remote learning into fall, it's arguably worth it to invest in better tech and intact crayons-the tools your kids need to stay engaged with classmates and the curriculum.

title: Here's How to Financially Prepare for Returning to Work or College
summary: Now is the time to get your budget and other documents in order. Thinking about your finances can be daunting, while overhauling your budget may be a challenge, but financial planners say you should try to prepare as much as you can as you head back to work or to college during the pandemic.

title: Does Robinhood's Design Make Trading Too Easy?
summary: Some behavioral researchers say the app's simplicity encourages novice investors to take bigger risks. Few brokerage apps have captured people's attention like Robinhood Markets Inc. The Silicon Valley company has turned the complex process of trading stocks into a simple, free swipe across a screen.

title: Possible F-35 Jet Sale to U.A.E. Puts Israel in Bind
summary: Officials said the jet fighter gives Israel clear superiority in the region, and that while the U.A.E. is friendly now, that could change. TEL AVIV-Talks between the U.S. and the United Arab Emirates on a potential sale of advanced F-35 jets are raising thorny questions for Israel's security in the Middle East.

title: Justice Department's Antitrust Chief Plans Shake Up
summary: Restructuring is aimed at bolstering scrutiny of the financial sector, compliance across industries with government antitrust settlements. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department's top antitrust official is shaking up internal operations, aiming to better coordinate enforcement in the financial sector and ensure that companies across the economy stick to commitments they make in legal settlements designed to protect competition.

title: Covid-19 Data Will Once Again Be Collected by CDC, in Policy Reversal
summary: Hospitals will return to reporting new cases to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Trump administration says, after shift to Health and Human Services led to delays and data problems. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is reversing course on a change to the way hospitals report critical information on the coronavirus pandemic to the government, returning the responsibility for data collection to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Pentagon Approves Five Drone Makers for Military Sales
summary: U.S. largely banned the purchase of commercial, off-the-shelf drones in 2018 until it could determine how to mitigate security risks. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Department of Defense has given five small drone manufacturers permission to sell to the U.S. military and federal agencies, in the wake of last year's ban on these agencies buying Chinese-made drones.

title: From Jimi Hendrix to Colin Kaepernick, the Afro as Rebellion
summary: How quarantine restrictions led one writer to proudly embrace his 'fro. THE AFRO HAD always been a transitional style for me-a pit stop on my way from a high-bald fade to cornrows or locs. But when the coronavirus lockdown made it irresponsible to let someone else cut, twist or braid my hair, I was forced to embrace my Afro on its own terms.

title: Former House Speaker Paul Ryan Starts Blank-Check Company
summary: Executive Network Partnering will seek to raise roughly $300 million in an initial public offering. Paul Ryan, the consummate Washington negotiator, is trying his hand at another kind of deal making, jumping into the rush on Wall Street toward blank-check acquisition companies.

title: Why Jumbo Mortgage Rates Make No Sense Right Now
summary: Following the Covid-19 outbreak, loan rates vary more widely between jumbo lenders. The pandemic has affected jumbo loans in an odd way: rates charged by the nation's mortgage lenders, which usually fall within a 10th of a percentage point of each other, are all over the place.

title: Islamist Attacks in Mozambique Threaten to Disrupt Total-Led Natural-Gas Project
summary: The takeover of the East African port by an Islamic State-affiliated group is triggering new fighting in a region heavy with gas-production investment. Fighting between Islamic extremist rebels and Mozambique's army over a key port is threatening to disrupt the East African nation's burgeoning natural-gas developments, including a multibillion-dollar project led by French energy giant Total SA .

title: What Kamala Harris Isn't Saying About Her Mother's Background
summary: Tamil Brahmins like Shyamala Gopalan fled identity politics and socialism for the U.S.. As we learn about Kamala Harris, we're also learning about her late mother. On the senator's website and in numerous speeches, Ms. Harris traces her inspiration for "fighting injustice" to Shyamala Gopalan, "an Indian-American immigrant, activist, and breast cancer researcher." In her speech to the Democratic National Convention Wednesday, Ms. Harris called her mother, who died of cancer in 2009, "the most important person in my life."

title: A Virtual Convention? At Least There Are No Stink Bombs
summary: Chicago in 1968 was a mad, violent, vivid circus, and, being young and anarchistic, I enjoyed it.. At my first political convention-in Chicago in 1968-I stood on the sidewalk by the Hilton on Michigan Avenue. Mayor Richard Daley's cops-big men, built like beer trucks-charged out of a side street. They waved riot batons and smashed heads, and young people ran to and fro, streaming blood. There was tear gas and barbed wire and screaming-all in a style of political rage that would reappear more than 50 years later, in the Black Lives Matter upheavals.

title: U.S. Sanctions Syrian Ex-TV News Anchor, Others in Bid to Pressure Assad
summary: Officials say revived pressure campaign is meant to shed light on extent of regime's alleged war crimes. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration on Thursday levied sanctions against a Syrian former television reporter-turned government spokeswoman, a financier and other senior Syrian government and military officials, expanding its pressure campaign against the regime of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Economic Recovery Is Hardly in the Bag
summary: New readings indicate U.S. economy remains at risk of faltering. The stock market might be logging new highs, but the economy isn't close to being out of the woods. Thursday's data make that clear.

title: Green-Energy Shares Rise Along With Joe Biden's Polling
summary: Democratic presidential nominee has pledged a variety of clean-energy policies that could benefit related industries. Investors betting that Joe Biden will win the presidential election are buying up clean-energy stocks, sending the share prices of some companies to all-time highs.

title: Rewards for Giving to Charity
summary: A behavioral economist answers questions on offering premiums for donations, wearing masks and practicing what he preaches.. Dear Dan,

title: Iran Unveils New Missiles, Improving Its Reach at Sea and to Israel
summary: Move demonstrates development of an arsenal with sophistication and reach capable of threatening foes across the region. Iran unveiled two new missiles Thursday amid fresh tensions with the U.S. and its allies in the Middle East, demonstrating a development of an arsenal with sophistication and reach capable of threatening and deterring its foes across the region.

title: Trump Must Release His Tax Returns to Manhattan Prosecutors, Judge Rules
summary: President's arguments that the subpoena was overbroad and issued to harass Trump were dismissed. A federal judge dismissed President Trump's second attempt to block the Manhattan District Attorney's Office from obtaining years of financial records from his accountant.

title: Silicon Valley and Wall Street Elites Pour Money Into Psychedelic Research
summary: Donors raise $30 million for psychedelic nonprofit to complete clinical trials around drug-assisted psychotherapy for trauma. A group of Silicon Valley and Wall Street executives has raised $30 million to speed the development of a closely watched psychedelic-drug therapy using the key ingredient of the party drug Ecstasy to treat trauma patients.

title: To Build a Plane That Can Fly Itself, Start With a Pilot in the Cockpit
summary: Startup Xwing envisions testing automated controls on cargo planes. A Northern California startup has devised a novel strategy to create planes that can fly themselves, by first testing a new generation of automated flight controls during conventional cargo flights flown by pilots.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Rose to 1.1 Million in Latest Week
summary: Data indicate layoffs remain elevated as labor market slowly improves. New applications for unemployment benefits rose last week after a series of declines, another sign the labor market's recovery is cooling amid continuing disruptions because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: American Airlines to Cut Service to Small Cities
summary: Airline says end of flights to 15 cities coincides with end of government funds. Some small cities will be without air service altogether in October when American Airlines Group Inc. cuts flights, as a fight to extend additional federal funds has been mired in a broader stalemate over pandemic relief.

title: Reopening Schools Is So Complicated, New York Is Struggling to Schedule Classes
summary: Resume Subscription. Jonathan Halabi, a math teacher who creates the course schedules for his Bronx high school, faces a daunting puzzle: Trying to match changing numbers of students to teachers and rooms while obeying class size limits required by the new coronavirus.

title: Jack Ma's Ant Group Produces $3.5 Billion Profit in Six Months as IPO Looms
summary: Results show how lucrative the Chinese financial-technology giant's business has been as it gears up for blockbuster offering. HONG KONG-Ant Group Co., the Chinese financial-technology giant backed by billionaire Jack Ma, earned roughly $3.5 billion over a recent six-month period, showing how lucrative the company's business has been as it gears up for a blockbuster initial public offering.

title: Covid-19 Pounds NYC Real Estate Worse Than 9/11, Financial Crash
summary: Resume Subscription. The Covid-19 crisis has delivered a stunning gut-punch to the New York City luxury real-estate market, applying downward pressure at a rate that surpasses both the 2008 financial crisis and the period immediately following the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

title: Luxury Real Estate Rides Out The Pandemic
summary: Buyers, sellers and developers weather the storm.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Tesla Owners Can Find Their Electric Flame
summary: A new dating app exclusively for Tesla owners helps the eco-conscious hook up with something other than a power outlet. If someone purchasing a top-of-the-line Tesla Model X a year ago had instead bought the company's shares, he or she would be sitting on a paper profit of three-quarters of a million dollars by now. But then, while money can't buy you love, that Tesla might.

title: Why You Should Never Buy Camping Gear Again
summary: Or almost never, that is. With rental options on the rise, not all 'essential' equipment deserves a permanent spot in your garage. For fairweather campers, buying-not to mention storing and maintaining-a suite of camping gear for those two glorious weekends under the stars each year is a questionable investment. Rather than hitting up your more outdoorsy friends for loaner gear, look to outfitters like Arrive Outdoors and Xscape Pod, which offer online rentals and express delivery of high-end, fastidiously maintained backpacking and car-camping gear.

title: Mounting Debt Threatens to Derail New York Transit System
summary: Resume Subscription. New York's Metropolitan Transportation Authority needs to control its rising debt or it risks a drastic deterioration of service, budget watchdogs say.

title: Alibaba's Online Orders Soar During Coronavirus, Fueling a Sales Recovery
summary: China's most valuable technology company runs two of the country's most popular e-commerce websites. Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. said its fiscal first-quarter profit more than doubled from the same period a year earlier, mirroring the results of U.S. tech giants that have thrived as disruption from the coronavirus pandemic accelerated a migration online.

title: Holy Bleep! Curse Word Surge Torments Baseball, Other Sports
summary: With no fans in the stands, colorful language is getting extra play on the field. This is a column about curse words, and the deployment of curse words in sports. Don't worry: I'm not going to use a curse word here. At least none of the really good ones. I might use a drat, a rats, a Fudgesicles, or a phooey, or, if I get really agitated-and this is just a warning to the kids at home, curled up reading a print newspaper, as kids do-a gadzooks. But I'm not going to say $*#$@!. Or %&#*!, *#$#@, or #*$!(@%. And definitely not #$*#@*^!.

title: The Pleasure and Pain of Scientific Predictions
summary: Some physicists have waited a whole lifetime for reality to meet their expectations.. In recent months, two gorgeous experiments have reported convincing evidence for the existence of anyons, a new type of particle that can exist only inside of certain materials. Their distinctive feature is that they have a kind of primitive memory, enabling them to preserve information about their past motions. This feature makes anyons an important building block for future quantum computers.

title: Guilty Plea Entered in PdVSA Corruption Investigation
summary: Joint venture's former head of procurement was accused of conspiring to launder millions in bribe payments through the U.S.. A former procurement officer at a Petróleos de Venezuela SA subsidiary has pleaded guilty to an alleged role in a bribery scheme and a former Citgo manager has been indicted on money-laundering charges in the latest developments in a sprawling U.S. probe into alleged corruption at Venezuela's state-owned energy company.

title: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend List Beverly Hills Home for $23.95 Million
summary: The celebrity couple's decision to sell comes after they discovered Ms. Teigen is pregnant with their third child. Musician John Legend and model and social-media celebrity Chrissy Teigen, are listing their Beverly Hills home for $23.95 million.

title: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen's Beverly Hills Home
summary: Decorated in the couple's laid-back style, the house still has a few glamorous touches like Ms. Teigen's commanding closet.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Mexico City, Struggling to Provide Clean Water, Tests a New Method
summary: The coronavirus pandemic has made access to water even more important. Could a nonprofit's simple technology provide a model for other cities?. Author

title: Marcel Adams Escaped Forced Labor, Thrived in Real Estate
summary: Romanian-born entrepreneur, disillusioned with the Promised Land, started over in Canada. Though he was hardworking and good with numbers, Marcel Adams had trouble settling into a career. History seemed stacked against him.

title: Flooding Pounds China's Three Gorges Dam
summary: Water inflows to the world's largest dam are expected to reach record levels as Yangtze River rises after heavy rain. Heavy rains that again swelled the Yangtze River are expected to hit the Three Gorges Dam with its largest-ever flood this week.

title: Inside the Rise of Mohammed bin Salman
summary: The Saudi crown prince ascended with a taste for opulence, a hunger for money and a drive for power. The models arrived first. Boats carrying some 150 women, from Brazil, Russia and elsewhere, docked in the summer of 2015 at Velaa Private Island, an opulent Maldives resort. Upon arrival, each woman was driven in a golf cart to a clinic, tested for sexually transmitted diseases and settled into a private villa.

title: Covid Is No Excuse for Grand Jury Duty When You Can Serve From Your Bedroom
summary: Some state courts go virtual, allowing panels to hand up indictments from home. Nine acquaintances in a rural Arizona county chatted on Zoom like old friends, complimenting each others' couches and dogs.

title: Itching to Travel? Attend These Music and Film Festivals-Online
summary: A full slate of music, arts and film festivals scheduled for September is going virtual, bringing top talent-and a Scottish treasure hunt-directly to couch potatoes. Traditionally, most people reach the Orkney Islands-a wild archipelago off Scotland's northern coast-by plane or ferry, or a combination thereof. This year, simply log on to the Foraging Fortnight festival (Aug. 29-Sept. 13) to catch daily glimpses of the craggy coastline, ancient woodlands and island kitchens. In partnership with the annual Orkney International Science Festival, which draws Nobel laureates to this remote enclave, the two-week festival includes a hunt for wild plants with an ethnobotanist, a cooking demo with a local chef, a papermaking class and a few sessions with traditional Orcadian musicians. According to Howie Firth, the director of the Orkney International Science Festival, the events will educate the audience on the beauty and perhaps surprising value of plantlife like dandelions and seaweed. "About 5,000 years ago, the Orkney Islands were at the center of the Neolithic world; today they are a leader in marine renewable energy and tidal power," he said. Find the event calendar at foragingfortnight.co.uk; events are streamed on the festival's YouTube channel.

title: This Stock Could Be a Real Kitchen Nightmare
summary: Restaurant equipment provider Middleby may be due for a sharp fall. Selling restaurant equipment is a bad business to be in right now. You wouldn't know that looking at Middleby 's stock price.

title: A Hidden Winner in the Covid-19 Rush to Upgrade Warehouses
summary: Kion Group's warehouse-automation division is booming as retailers scramble to invest in their online businesses. A forklift company might seem an unlikely tech visionary, but Kion Group 's 2016 bet on e-commerce and warehouse automation now looks particularly savvy.

title: Battered Eurozone Could See More Stimulus in the Fall
summary: ECB warns of turbulence as governments start to wind down policies aimed at supporting the economy through the pandemic. FRANKFURT-European Central Bank officials signaled that they could roll out new monetary stimulus in the fall to shore up economic growth, as the region wrestles with rising unemployment and a possible wave of corporate bankruptcies.

title: DNC: Four Key Takeaways From Night Three
summary: Democrats made a robust appeal to women, previewed legislative agenda on evening Kamala Harris accepted vice-presidential nomination. Democrats used the third night of their convention to make a strong appeal to women as Kamala Harris accepted her historic nomination for vice president.

title: Lance Armstrong, Ryan Lochte and the Marketing of Controversy
summary: Elite athletes are trying to wrest control of their media depictions with a slew of tell-all documentaries. Has the public appetite for sports controversy reached a fever pitch?. Earlier this month, when former world No. 1 golfer Jordan Spieth finished 71st at the PGA Championship in San Francisco, speculation about why Spieth's star had fallen precipitously-from top-ranked in 2016 to 63rd place today-hung over him like a cloud. Several commentators and publications, from the Telegraph to ESPN, had recently asked some version of the question, "What happened to Jordan Spieth?" During the PGA Championship through which he continued to struggle, Golf Magazine published an article tying his "downfall" to a minor adjustment he made to his driving game in the offseason of 2016.

title: Biden to Seek Emotional Connection in Virtual Speech to DNC
summary: Democratic presidential nominee favors storytelling with simple, direct language and at times shows feeling in public remarks. Joe Biden's backslapping political skills have always served him better chatting in ice cream shops than speaking from a podium. But as he prepares to deliver the biggest speech of his political career, Democrats hope his folksy speaking style will match the moment.

title: Baseball's Best Young Player Swings on 3-0. Here's Why Everyone Should.
summary: Fernando Tatís Jr. inadvertently drew attention to a surprising victim of baseball's data revolution: the automatic take sign when the count is 3-0.. Fernando Tatís Jr., the San Diego Padres' 21-year-old shortstop, has emerged as the biggest story in baseball this week for a perplexing reason: He had the audacity to try to do his job as well as he could.

title: Red Flags Point to Faltering Recovery in Oil
summary: Prices for West African crude and Brent-crude contracts that are set to expire shortly have sagged, indicating a slowing resurgence in energy demand. After rebounding from a historic crash this spring, the oil market is back under pressure from the twin forces of rising supply and stalling demand.

title: As Covid-19 Symptoms Linger, Demand for Specialized Clinics Surges
summary: Hospitals set up clinics, add staff to treat patients with long-term symptoms. A backlog of patients is growing at new clinics dedicated to Covid-19 survivors who continue to have symptoms many weeks or months after getting sick.

title: South Korea's Male-Dominated Workplaces in Spotlight After Sexual Harassment Accusations
summary: Women say atmosphere of sexual discrimination and harassment is pervasive; It is 'so natural, like air,' one woman says. SEOUL-Allegations of sexual harassment and abuse that have emerged after a former mayor of Seoul was found dead last month in an apparent suicide have forced a new reckoning with the legacy of South Korea's #MeToo movement.

title: Turkey Keeps Rates Unchanged Even as Lira Plumbs Record Lows
summary: Tightening money supply through other means may not be sufficient to avert another currency selloff, analysts say. ISTANBUL-The Turkish central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged Thursday, in line with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's demand to keep it low, but leaving the emerging economy exposed to further capital flight and a potential currency crisis similar to the selloff that beset Turkey two years ago.

title: Twitter Data Case Sparks Dispute, Delay Among EU Privacy Regulators
summary: Disagreement could delay other investigations into Facebook, Google and other U.S. tech companies. European Union privacy regulators are clashing over how much-if anything-to fine Twitter Inc. for its handling of a data breach disclosed last year, delaying progress of the most advanced cross-border privacy case involving a U.S. tech company under the EU's strict new privacy law.

title: Covid-19 Hits India's Already Faltering Consumers Hardest
summary: Sales from cars to shampoo that were already depressed have dropped further, as coronavirus cases have surged. India's emerging middle-class consumers, until a few years ago the engine of the world's fastest-growing big economy, were faltering even before the coronavirus arrived.

title: How to Get Your Finances in Order Before Returning to Work
summary: Your emergency fund, health accounts and coverage, estate planning and budgeting should all be considered. The pandemic has shed fresh light on the need for workers to make sure their budgets, wills and insurance coverage are in good shape no matter what their age. As some businesses and schools reopen this fall, and employees head back to public spaces, many might want to make sure their finances are in order in case they become sick with the coronavirus.

title: Australian Dollar Rebounds on Iron Ore and Gold Rush
summary: The currency is at its strongest since early 2019, also helped by weakness in the U.S. dollar. SYDNEY-The Australian dollar is the strongest it has been since early 2019, as rallies in iron ore and gold help to offset economic shocks caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: DNC Nominates Kamala Harris in a Historic Selection for VP
summary: Former President Obama, Hillary Clinton hail Biden-Harris ticket, take aim at Trump. Kamala Harris accepted the Democratic vice-presidential nomination-becoming the first Black woman to hold that position-in a prime-time address Wednesday that emphasized the historic nature of her candidacy while arguing Joe Biden is the uniting leader the country needs.

title: Slack Has Made Remote Office Communication Easier. It Can Also Be Less Civil.
summary: Most Popular News. Soon after employees at the online invitation site Evite began working from home in March, the company sent staffers guidelines for navigating remote-office life.

title: How China Targets Scientists via Network of Recruiting Stations
summary: New study details inner workings of talent recruitment programs linked to misconduct. WASHINGTON-China is targeting top scientific and technological expertise in the U.S. and other advanced nations through an expanding network of 600 talent-recruitment stations world-wide, a new report partly funded by the U.S. State Department has found.

title: China's Chip Fab Purchases Will Be Big in Japan
summary: Tokyo Electron could benefit from chilly relations between Washington and Beijing. In a building frenzy, it's good to sell the tools. Japan's Tokyo Electron , one of the world's largest semiconductor equipment makers, could be a good bet as China strives to develop its own chip industry.

title: Michigan to Pay $600 Million in Flint Water Crisis Settlement
summary: Tens of thousands of Flint residents could receive money over lead-tainted drinking water. The state of Michigan is expected to announce a settlement this week to pay residents of Flint $600 million to resolve civil claims from the city's lead-tainted drinking water crisis, according to a person familiar with the settlement.

title: Insurance Executive Greg Lindberg Sentenced to Seven Years and Three Months in Prison
summary: Mr. Lindberg had been convicted of attempting to bribe elected official; appeal is likely. A federal judge sentenced insurance executive Greg Lindberg to seven years and three months in prison for attempting to bribe a state insurance commissioner with campaign contributions to secure more favorable regulatory treatment for his insurers.

title: Fed Minutes to Shed Light on Central Bank Strategy Review
summary: Officials have weighed a more relaxed approach to inflation after years of undershooting their 2% target. Minutes from the Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting are likely to shed more light on how central bank officials will wrap up their yearlong strategy review by effectively abandoning their past practice of pre-emptively lifting interest rates to head off higher inflation.

title: Trump Praises QAnon Followers as 'People That Love Our Country'
summary: President said he knew little about the far-right conspiracy-theory group but welcomed their support. WASHINGTON-President Trump welcomed the support of followers of the far-right QAnon conspiracy theory Wednesday, saying he knew little about the theory but suggesting that those who subscribe to it are patriots who back his presidency.

title: Facebook Removes QAnon Groups
summary: Social-media giant takes action after data shows popularity of extremist conspiracy theory has exploded. Facebook Inc. said it is removing and will limit the spread of accounts that celebrate or suggest violence, including those associated with QAnon as part of a crackdown on the extremist conspiracy theory that has thrived on the company's platforms in recent years.

title: U.S. Risks Diplomatic Isolation With Bid to Reimpose U.N. Sanctions on Iran
summary: China, Russia, others say U.S. lacks authority to 'snap back' sanctions after leaving nuclear accord. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration's bid in the coming days to reimpose United Nations sanctions against Iran, on the heels of its failed effort last week to extend an arms embargo on its Middle East foe, risks isolating the U.S. diplomatically while doing little to curb Iran's access to weapons from Russia and China, analysts and diplomats said.

title: Senate Report Faults FBI's Handling of 2016 Election Probes
summary: Report criticizes agency's use of Steele dossier, process for notifying DNC of Russian hack. WASHINGTON-A bipartisan Senate report detailing the 2016 Trump campaign's vulnerability to Russian spying also found faults in the FBI's handling of its investigations into Moscow's election meddling, including the agency's reliance on possible Kremlin disinformation.
